intro: Sebastiania gracilis, commonly known as the slender sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in shaded, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and glossy, elliptical leaves. It produces bright yellow-orange fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
